chargeHist.descr: Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child

result.execSummary:
This case is being appealed. If the court makes a decision in a case that a party disagrees with, the party may have the right to seek review by a higher court to determine if the trial court's decision was correct. Appeals are most often made after a trial or final decision in a case, but an appeal can also occur before a final decision.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Attorney Fees To Be Determined.  Probation does NOT collect attorney fees.
If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Must obtain and maintain employment. If unemployed or underemployed, must seek work at 5 different places per week and provide proof to Probation Agent.
Must have no unsupervised contact with juvenile females.

Must successfully undergo a pyscho-sexual evaluation and follow-up with recommendation.
Issue of sex-offender registration is held open at this time.
Must provide DNA sample.

supervisions.notes:
Dodge Correctional Institution as reception facility. 
Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 
Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.

superMiscConds.notes: Must register as a sex offender for 15 years. Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Must maintain absolute sobriety, except for prescription medications prescribed to him and taken as prescribed.

Outstanding financial obligations are reduced to civil judgment.

2:58 PM Prosecuting attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jonathon S Geiger appeared by video.  Attorney Andrew T Knaak in court for Jonathon S Geiger. 

3:02  Court relates and gives appearances.  This is an adjourned hearing on issue regarding request from state to impose costs of extradition; issue is whether or not 973.06(1)(a) applies.
3:06  State relates and makes argument.
3:09  Atty. Knaak makes argument.
3:12  Court relates.
3:15  Atty. Knaak relates.
3:16  Court relates.  Based on facts and circumstances of this case, court issued a bench warrant and defendant was arrested as a result of that, and 973.06(1)(a) applies. Court clearly finds warrant was issued and he was arrested as a result of that.
Court grants State's motion for those costs to be included and that the JOC be amended to add the costs as requested by the State; Court signs order for the same.
